column5: I was going over the hill!!  LOL..  Monique and I headed up for what turned out to be an incredible long weekend.  Left the kids at home and although it was in August we celebrated our 20th anniversary.  I couldn't imagine a better p[lace to do it.  The weather was fantastic and the nights were so bright we took our first ever midnight run up the river.  I even caught a decent pike on topwater at 11pm.  Here's some pics from the weekend.   We also used a pink lucky strike lure from http://www.highlightsforhope.ca/ a project a good friend of ours is working on (plug - plug)  it was pretty hot all weekend even up north, I installed an umbrella in the boat to stop my lard from melting into butter...  lol.  and there were mosquitoes.. which is odd for this time of year.  The beavers were hard at work all weekend, and we saw our first otter on the river.  I did a little bit of work, I put in a new built to spec - custom bush electrical panel for the multitudes of stuff we run/charge/watch and listen too, and put the splitter to work for the afternoon as well. I love that thing.   We even managed a feed of pickeral, small, but super tasty.  We're catching small ones in 40 feet of water.. and I still can't find the larger ones.. but I'll keep looking.  That it till next time.  (Partridge opens soon so watch out...  Monique also got an antlerless deer tag for our area, this is the first year they even have a season in our WMU)
hey... that last pic is making me hunnngry.////  thanks for the adventure...
This is going to sound corny, but those pictures make me long for taking my wife to a cottage. Nice TJ, thanks. Jim
Thank for sharing BOSS it sure is great to read these report I look forward to each one they are on my favorite list of all threads
I want yer life,just not the web site though.LOL Looks like another great time. TFS.

You guys are living the rough life up there!!! LOL I love that custom bush electrical panel you put in LOL  it will just do the job nicely. Happy belated 20th and congratulations to both of you  Me and the missus are leaving shortly for dinner to celebrate our 20th.... Thanks for sharing Leechman
Excellent report and pics TJ!!!
Nice Bass fillets the TJ.   The fish look bigger. Might be the full moon. Nice wiring rig ya got there. Must have some electrical experience. The Cray fish tails are absolutely  huge!!!
The fishing looked great way down south there.

Awesome report hon.  Looks like the home away from home is getting alot comfier!!  Those midnight cruises are great, and they usually produce when the full moon is out.  Did ya hear any wolves baying?  Joey
I don't want to start anything but that person that bass is holding is OOS  in that sector/providence/ zone 3. Or did you write your own rules for camp jiggity/jiggity o da dew da day.    Art
I'm King of the North... I do what I want.
I AM SOOOO JEALOUS!!!
wow, looks like a nearly perfect weekend TJ! Love the umbrella, I was going to put a roof in my boat next summer, you may of given me a idea lol  Thanks for sharing as always, MTBF
AAAKKK put on a shirt man!Good stuff bud. Joe
now thats living ,awesome thanks for sharing
Great report TJ  Are you planning to make it to the centre for the moose hunt this year?
Congrat's on the anniversary. Things are looking good at your camp, nice work.
Another anniversary, didn't you have one last year? Congratulations TJ and Monique. Great way to spend it too.
Very good TJ! Wish my wife would celebrate anniversary's like that.

Happy Belated Anniversary TJ and Monique!     Love the panel (rigged up something similar in the house for all the rechargeable things)  Looks like an awesome weekend for two wonderful people.   I wish you many more happy years and trips to Camp Jiggy Jiggy.
